name: Button

unions.name: Button
unions.comment:
Type hint buttons

    type alias model =
        { headerTitle : String
        , headerButtons : List (Button Msg)
        }

values.name: green
values.comment: Style it green

values.name: href
values.comment: Open a href url when clicked

values.name: hrefBlank
values.comment: Open a href url when clicked

values.name: icon
values.comment: Set an icon

values.name: isDisabled
values.comment: Display as disabled, removing the click Msg

values.name: isLoading
values.comment: Display as loading, removing the click Msg

values.name: onClick
values.comment: Fire a Msg when clicked

values.name: red
values.comment: Style it red

values.name: render
values.comment: Render the button

values.name: small
values.comment: Make the button small

values.name: text
values.comment: Set the text

values.name: view
values.comment: Init a button

values.name: viewIf
values.comment: Init a button if True

name: Card

unions.name: CardBlock
unions.comment: Type hint a function that returns a card block

values.name: block
values.comment: Add a block

values.name: blockIf
values.comment: Add a block conditionally
values.type: Grid.Size.Cols -> Basics.Bool -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Card.CardBlock msg

values.name: blockSizes
values.comment: Add a block of varying sizes
values.type: Grid.Size.Cols -> List.List ( Grid.Size.Size, Grid.Size.Cols ) -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Card.CardBlock msg

values.name: body
values.comment: Add a body block
values.type: List.List (Card.CardBlock msg) -> Card.Config msg -> Card.Config msg

values.name: footer
values.comment: Add a footer block
values.type: List.List (Button.Button msg) -> Card.Config msg -> Card.Config msg

values.name: header
values.comment: Add a header block
values.type: String.String -> List.List (Button.Button msg) -> Card.Config msg -> Card.Config msg

values.name: maybeBlock
values.comment: Add a block and apply Just
values.type: Grid.Size.Cols -> Maybe.Maybe a -> (a -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg)) -> Card.CardBlock msg

values.name: render
values.comment: Render

values.name: view
values.comment: Init a card

values.name: viewIf
values.comment: Init a card conditionally

name: Css.Bdt

values.name: styleIf
values.comment:
Optionally add a Style.

    css
        [ cursor pointer |> Css.styleIf canToggle
        ]

name: Form.DatePicker

unions.name: Model
unions.comment:
Add a DatePicker.Model to your model.

    type alias MyModel =
        { myDatePicker : DatePicker.Model
        }

aliases.name: Msg
aliases.comment:
Add a DatePicker.Msg to your Msg.

    type MyMsg
        = UpdateMyDatePicker DatePicker.Msg

values.name: getId
values.comment: Useful if you need the id of the datePicker in your update function, to set focus etc.

values.name: getInitialPosix
values.comment: Get the initial Date of your datePicker.

values.name: getIsChanged
values.comment: Whether your datePicker was changed. Useful if you want to disable save buttons unless there were changes etc.

values.name: getIsOpen
values.comment: Whether this datePicker is currently open.

values.name: getSelectedPosix
values.comment:
Get the current Date of your datePicker. This is what you'd use to display the data somewhere outside of your datePicker,
or to send the data to the backend for example etc.

values.name: init
values.comment:
Init a DatePicker.Model in your model.

    myInitialModel : MyModel
    myInitialModel =
        { myDatePicker = DatePicker.init
        }

values.name: reInitialise
values.comment: ReInitialise your DatePicker.Model.

values.name: render
values.comment:
Transforms an DatePicker.View into Html DatePicker.Msg

    myView : Model -> Html Msg
    myView model =
        div
            []
            [ DatePicker.view model.myDatePicker
                |> DatePicker.render
                |> Html.map UpdateMyDatePicker
            ]

values.name: reset
values.comment: Reset your DatePicker.Model.

values.name: setDefaultLabel
values.comment: Set the default label, for example (-- NOTHING SELECTED --).

values.name: setId
values.comment: Give your datePicker an id. Can be useful for DOM selectors (focus, WebComponents etc.)

values.name: setIncludeTime
values.comment: Sets whether your date picker should include a time picker.

values.name: setInitialPosix
values.comment: Set the initial Date of your DatePicker.Model.

values.name: setIsClearable
values.comment: Set whether your datePicker is clearable (x icon).

values.name: setIsError
values.comment: Set whether your datePicker is in error mode (red border).

values.name: setIsInput
values.comment: Set whether your date picker is displayed as an input.

values.name: setIsLocked
values.comment: Set whether your datePicker is locked (disabled).

values.name: setMaxPosix
values.comment: Set the min. date. Dates subsequent to this can't be selected. Navigation is also capped to this date.

values.name: setMinPosix
values.comment: Set the min. date. Dates prior to this can't be selected. Navigation is also capped to this date.

values.name: setSelectedPosix
values.comment: Change the Date of your DatePicker.Model.

values.name: setTimeZone
values.comment: Set the TimeZone

values.name: update
values.comment:
Use in your update function.

    myUpdate : Msg -> Model -> ( Model, Cmd Msg )
    myUpdate msg model =
        case msg of
            UpdateMyDatePicker datePickerMsg ->
                let
                    ( newDatePicker, cmd ) =
                        DatePicker.update datePickerMsg mode.myDatePicker
                in
                { model | myDatePicker = newDatePicker } ! [ cmd ]

values.name: view
values.comment:
Transform an DatePicker.Model into an DatePicker.View, which allows us to pipe View Setters on it.

    myView : Model -> Html Msg
    myView model =
        div
            []
            [ DatePicker.view model.myDatePicker -- pipe view setters here, for example |> setIsLocked 'your logic here'
            ]

name: Form.FloatInput

unions.name: Model
unions.comment:
Add a Input.Model to your model.

    type alias MyModel =
        { myInput : Input.Model
        }

aliases.name: Msg
aliases.comment:
Add a Input.Msg to your Msg.

    type MyMsg
        = UpdateMyInput Input.Msg

values.name: getId
values.comment: Useful if you need the id of the input in your update function, so set focus etc.

values.name: getInitialValue
values.comment: Get the initial value of your input.

values.name: getIsChanged
values.comment: Whether your input was changed. Useful if you want to disable save buttons unless there were changes etc.

values.name: getValue
values.comment:
Get the current value of your input. This is what you'd use to display the data somewhere outside of your input,
or to send the data to the backend for example etc.

values.name: init
values.comment:
Add a Input.Model to your model.

    myInitialModel : MyModel
    myInitialModel =
        { myInput = Input.init -- optionally pipe into State Setters
        }

values.name: reInitialise
values.comment: ReInitialise your FloatInput.Model.

values.name: render
values.comment:
Transforms an Input.View into Html Input.Msg

    myView : Model -> Html Msg
    myView model =
        div
            []
            [ Input.view model.myInput
                |> Input.render
                |> Html.map UpdateMyInput
            ]

values.name: reset
values.comment: Reset your FloatInput.Model.

values.name: setDecimal
values.comment: Change the number of decimal places of your FloatInput.Model.

values.name: setId
values.comment: Give your input an id. Can be useful for DOM selectors (focus, WebComponents etc.)

values.name: setInitialValue
values.comment: Set the initial value of your FloatInput.Model.

values.name: setIsError
values.comment: Set whether your input is in error mode (red border).

values.name: setIsLocked
values.comment: Set whether your input is locked (disabled).

values.name: setMaxLength
values.comment: Set the max length for your input string.

values.name: setPlaceholder
values.comment: Set a placeholder for your input.

values.name: setValue
values.comment: Change the value of your FloatInput.Model.

values.name: update
values.comment:
Use in your update function.

    myUpdate : Msg -> Model -> ( Model, Cmd Msg )
    myUpdate msg model =
        case msg of
            UpdateMyInput inputMsg ->
                { model | myInput = Input.update inputMsg mode.myInput } ! []

values.name: view
values.comment:
Transform an Input.Model into an Input.View, which allows us to pipe View Setters on it.

    myView : Model -> Html Msg
    myView model =
        div
            []
            [ Input.view model.myInput -- pipe view setters here, for example |> setIsLocked 'your logic here'
            ]

name: Form.MultiSelect

unions.name: Model
unions.comment:
Add a MultiSelect.Model to your model.

    type MusicGenre
        = Rock
        | Jazz
        | Blues
        | Metal

    type alias MyModel =
        { myMultiSelect : MultiSelect.Model MusicGenre
        }

aliases.name: Msg
aliases.comment:
Add a MultiSelect.Msg to your Msg.

    type MyMsg
        = UpdateMyMultiSelect MultiSelect.Msg

values.name: getId
values.comment: Useful if you need the id of the select in your update function, to set focus etc.

values.name: getInitialOptions
values.comment: Get the initial option of your select.

values.name: getIsChanged
values.comment: Whether your select was changed. Useful if you want to disable save buttons unless there were changes etc.

values.name: getIsOpen
values.comment: Whether this select is currently open.

values.name: getSelectedOptions
values.comment:
Get the current option of your select. This is what you'd use to display the data somewhere outside of your select,
or to send the data to the backend for example etc.

values.name: init
values.comment:
Add a MultiSelect.Model to your model.

    myInitialModel : MyModel
    myInitialModel =
        { myMultiSelect = MultiSelect.init <| Nonempty Rock [ Jazz, Blues, Metal ]
        }

values.name: reInitialise
values.comment: ReInitialise your MultiSelect.Model.

values.name: render
values.comment:
Transforms an MultiSelect.View into Html MultiSelect.Msg

    myView : Model -> Html Msg
    myView model =
        div
            []
            [ MultiSelect.view model.myMultiSelect
                |> MultiSelect.render
                |> Html.map UpdateMyMultiSelect
            ]

values.name: reset
values.comment: Reset your MultiSelect.Model.

values.name: setDefaultLabel
values.comment: Set the default label, for example (-- NOTHING SELECTED --).

values.name: setId
values.comment: Give your select an id. Can be useful for DOM selectors (focus, WebComponents etc.)

values.name: setInitialOptions
values.comment: Set the initial option of your MultiSelect.Model.
values.type: List.List option -> Form.MultiSelect.Model option -> Form.MultiSelect.Model option

values.name: setIsClearable
values.comment: Set whether your select is clearable (x icon).

values.name: setIsError
values.comment: Set whether your select is in error mode (red border).

values.name: setIsLocked
values.comment: Set whether your select is locked (disabled).

values.name: setIsOptionDisabled
values.comment: This function allows you to disable specific options.

values.name: setSelectedOptions
values.comment: Change the option of your MultiSelect.Model.
values.type: List.List option -> Form.MultiSelect.Model option -> Form.MultiSelect.Model option

values.name: update
values.comment:
Use in your update function.

    myUpdate : Msg -> Model -> ( Model, Cmd Msg )
    myUpdate msg model =
        case msg of
            UpdateMyMultiSelect selectMsg ->
                let
                    ( newSelect, cmd ) =
                        MultiSelect.update selectMsg mode.myMultiSelect
                in
                { model | myMultiSelect = newSelect } ! [ cmd ]
values.type: Form.MultiSelect.Msg option -> Form.MultiSelect.Model option -> ( Form.MultiSelect.Model option, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (Form.MultiSelect.Msg option) )

values.name: view
values.comment:
Transform an MultiSelect.Model into an MultiSelect.View, which allows us to pipe View Setters on it.

    myView : Model -> Html Msg
    myView model =
        div
            []
            [ model.myMultiSelect
                |> MultiSelect.view .name

            -- pipe view setters here, for example |> setIsLocked 'your logic here'
            ]

values.comment: Change the value of your TextArea.Model.

values.name: update
values.comment:
Use in your update function.

    myUpdate : Msg -> Model -> ( Model, Cmd Msg )
    myUpdate msg model =
        case msg of
            UpdateMyTextArea inputMsg ->
                { model | myTextArea = TextArea.update inputMsg mode.myTextArea } ! []

values.name: view
values.comment:
Transform an TextArea.Model into an TextArea.View, which allows us to pipe View Setters on it.

    myView : Model -> Html Msg
    myView model =
        div
            []
            [ TextArea.view model.myTextArea -- pipe view setters here, for example |> setIsLocked 'your logic here'
            ]

name: Grid

values.name: col
values.comment: Add a col

values.name: colSizes
values.comment: Add a col, specifying different col sizes based on window size

values.comment: Create a container

values.comment: Add a row

name: Grid.Size
Html.Styled.Bdt

values.name: attributeIf
values.comment:
Optionally add an attribute.

    button
        [ onClick MyMessage |> attributeIf model.isButtonEnabled ]
        [ text "Clickety Click" ]

values.name: divIf
values.comment:
Only display if True.

    divIf model.isShown
        [ id "potato" ]
        [ text "Hello" ]
values.type: Basics.Bool -> List.List (Html.Styled.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

values.name: maybeAttribute
values.comment:
Maybe add an attribute.

    button
        [ maybeAttribute onClick model.myMaybeMsg ]
        [ text "Clickety Click" ]
values.type: (a -> Html.Styled.Attribute msg) -> Maybe.Maybe a -> Html.Styled.Attribute msg

values.name: maybeView
values.comment:
Maybe display a view.

    maybeView view model.myMaybe
values.type: Maybe.Maybe a -> (a -> Html.Styled.Html msg) -> Html.Styled.Html msg

values.name: viewIf
values.comment:
Only display if True.

    viewIf model.isShown myViewFunction

name: List.Bdt

values.name: groupWhile
values.type: (a -> a -> Basics.Bool) -> List.List a -> List.List (List.Nonempty.Nonempty a)

name: List.Nonempty.Bdt

values.name: decoder
values.comment:
Nonempty decoder

    type alias Student =
        { firstName : String
        , courses : Nonempty Course
        }

    decoder : Decoder Student
    decoder =
        Decode.decode Student
            |> Decode.required "firstName" Decode.string
            |> Decode.required "courses" (Nonempty.decoder courseDecoder)

name: Resettable

unions.name: Resettable
unions.comment:
Represent values that may be initial or updated. It can be useful if you have a
a save button that should be disabled if nothing on a form changed.

    type alias MyProfileForm =
        { firstName : Resettable String
        , email : Resettable String
        }

    form =
        { firstName = Resettable.init "John Doe"
        , email = Resettable.init ""
        }

    shouldEnableSaveButton : Form -> Bool
    shouldEnableSaveButton form =
        Resettable.getIsChanged form.email || Resettable.getIsChanged form.password

values.name: getInitialValue
values.comment:
Get the initial value.

    getInitialValue (Initial "Josh") -- "Josh"

    getInitialValue (Updated "Josh" "Joshua") -- "Josh"

values.name: getIsChanged
values.comment:
Whether a value changed.

    getIsChanged (Initial "Josh")         -- False
    getIsChanged (Updated "Josh" "Joshua") -- True

    when checking a lot of values, it may be helpful to put them in a list:

    -- if they all have the same type:
    List.any getIsChanged [ Initial "Josh", Updated "Josh" "Joshua" ]   -- True

    -- if they have different types
    List.any ((==) True) [ getIsChanged (Initial "Josh"), getIsChanged (Initial 12) ]   -- False

values.name: getValue
values.comment:
Get the current value.

    getValue (Initial "Josh") -- "Josh"

    getValue (Updated "Josh" "Joshua") -- "Joshua"

values.name: init
values.comment:
Initialise a value.

    init "Bob" -- Initial "Bob"

values.name: reset
values.comment:
Reset to the initial value.

    reset (Initial "Josh") -- Initial "Josh"

    reset (Updated "Josh" "Joshua") -- Initial "Josh"

values.name: update
values.comment:
Updates a Resettable value.

    -- update to new value
    update "Joshua" (Initial "Josh") -- Updated "Josh" "Joshua"

    update "Bob" (Updated "Josh" "Joshua") -- Updated "Josh" "Bob"


    -- if the new value is the initial value or a changed value is set to it's initial value, keep the initial value
    update "Josh" (Initial "Josh") -- Initial "Bob"

    update "Josh" (Updated "Josh" "Joshua") -- Initial "Josh"

name: Set.Any.Bdt

values.comment: Toggle an item (add if not existing, remove if existing)
values.type: a -> Set.Any.AnySet comparable a -> Set.Any.AnySet comparable a

Orders 2 dates. This comes in handy with List.sortWith:

    List.sortWith Time.order [ date1, date2, date3 ]

name: Toasters

unions.name: Model
unions.comment:
Add a Toasters.Model to your model.

    type alias MyModel =
        { toasters : Toasters.Model
        }

unions.name: Msg
unions.comment:
Add a Toasters.Msg to your Msg.

    type MyMsg
        = ToastersMsg Toasters.Msg

values.name: addGreen
values.comment:
Add to your subscription function.

    myUpdate : Msg -> Model -> ( Model, Cmd Msg )
    myUpdate msg model =
        case msg of
            SavedSuccessfully ->
                { model
                    | isSaving = False
                    , toasters = Toasters.addGreen "Data saved Successfully :)" model.toasters
                }
                    ! []

values.name: addRed
values.comment:
Add to your subscription function.

    myUpdate : Msg -> Model -> ( Model, Cmd Msg )
    myUpdate msg model =
        case msg of
            SavingFailed ->
                { model
                    | isSaving = False
                    , toasters = Toasters.addRed "Data could not be saved :(" model.toasters
                }
                    ! []

values.name: init
values.comment:
Add a Toasters.Model to your model.

    myInitialModel : MyModel
    myInitialModel =
        { toasters = Toasters.init
        }

values.name: merge
subscription
values.comment:
Add to your subscription function.

    subscriptions : Model -> Sub Msg
    subscriptions model =
        Sub.batch
            [ Toasters.subscription model.toasters |> Sub.map Msg.ToastersMsg
            ]

values.name: update
values.comment:
Use in your update function.

    myUpdate : Msg -> Model -> ( Model, Cmd Msg )
    myUpdate msg model =
        case msg of
            ToastersMsg toastersMsg ->
                { model | toasters = Toasters.update toastersMsg model.toasters } ! []

values.name: view
values.comment:
Add to your view function.

    div
        []
        [ Toasters.view model.toasters
            |> Html.map ToastersMsg
        , div
            []
            [ text "My Cool App" ]
        ]
